{{Infobox film | name = Malibu Express | image_size = | image = Malibu Express FilmPoster.jpeg | caption = | director = [[Andy Sidaris]] | producer = Andy Sidaris | writer = Andy Sidaris | starring = [[Darby Hinton]]
[[Sybil Danning]]
[[Lynda Wiesmeier]]
Lori Sutton
[[Art Metrano]] | music = [[Henry Strzelecki]] | cinematography = Howard Wexler | editing = Craig Stewart
Howard Wexler | studio = Malibu Bay Films | distributor = [[Universal Studios]] | released = {{Film date|1985|03}} | runtime = 105 minutes | country = United States | language = English }} '''''Malibu Express''''' is a 1985 American action/adventure film starring [[Darby Hinton]], [[Sybil Danning]], Lori Sutton, and [[Art Metrano]]. It was directed, written, and produced by [[Andy Sidaris]].{{citation | last1=Coffman | first1= Jason | title=''Cashiers du Cinemart Issue 17'' | chapter= The Early Films of Andy Sidaris| year=2012 | publisher=Impossibly Funky Productions| isbn=978-1300351405| url =https://books.google.com/books?id=amj6AwAAQBAJ&pg=PA23&dq=%22Stacey%22+Andy+Sidaris&hl=en&sa=X&ei=io0dVc_BDtDnaO7vgegH&ved=0CBkQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22Stacey%22%20Andy%20Sidaris&f=false}} The film features 1980s ''[[Playboy]]'' [[Playboy Playmate|Playmates]] [[Kimberly McArthur]], [[Barbara Edwards (model)|Barbara Edwards]], [[Lorraine Michaels]], and [[Lynda Wiesmeier]] in its cast, as well. In it, Danning "cinched her image as B-budget bad girl".{{cite book |title=Boys and toys: ultimate action-adventure movies, Volume 2002 |author=Brode, Douglas |year=2003 |page=194| publisher=Citadel |isbn=978-0-8065-2381-1 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=hgHWBCVndpkC&pg=PA194}} [[Regis Philbin|Regis and Joy Philbin]] cameo as talk show hosts.{{cite book| title=Regis Philbin - The Unauthorized Biography |year=2001 |author= Tracy, Kathleen |page= 69 |publisher=[[ECW Press]] |isbn= 978-1-55022-439-9 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=msDfDRx6OK4C&pg=PA69#v=onepage&q&f=false| accessdate=17 July 2010}} ==Synopsis== Espionage threatens the security of American Computer Technology and a skirt-chasing private investigator is assigned by federal intelligence agencies to root out the spies among the rich, oversexed socialites unknowingly supporting them. ==Plot summary== A wealthy playboy/private-investigator named Cody Abilene is hired by a government intelligence operative to investigate a lead into who is selling computer technology to the Russians. While investigating rich socialites, amorous naked vixens, an ex-con with a penchant for blackmail, and keeping it all from his sexy lady cop friend Beverly Mcafee, Cody puts himself in the crosshairs of the traitorous tech-spies who will gladly kill to stay in business. The scope of the conspiracy is revealed after Cody and Beverly make love at a suspect's beachhouse, only to find a pair of hitmen gunning for them as they get dressed. Gunplay, car chases, and races ensue. ==Cast== *Darby Hinton as Cody Abilene *Sybil Danning as Contessa Luciana *Art Metrano as Matthew *Shelley Taylor Morgan as Anita Chamberlain *Brett Baxter Clark as Shane (as Brett Clark) *Niki Dantine as Lady Lillian Chamberlain *Lori Sutton as Beverly *Lorraine Michaels as Liza Chamberlain *Lynda Wiesmeier as June Khnockers *Kimberly McArthur as Faye *Barbara Edwards as May *Abb Dickson as P. L. Buffington *Busty O'Shea as Doreen Buffington *Randy Rudy as Bobo Buffington *Michael A. Andrews as Stuart Chamberlain (as Michael Andrews) *Richard Brose as Mark *John Brown as Luke *Suzanne M. Regard as Sexy Sally (as Suzanne Regard) *John Alderman as Lieutenant Arledge *Robyn Hilton as Maid Marian *Les Steinmetz as Johnathan Harper *Robert Darnell as Douglas Wilton *Jeanine Vargas as Rodney, the Photographer *Peter Knecht as Peter *Harry Hauss as Helicopter Pilot *Ruth Stamer as Answering Service Girl *Peggy Ann Filsinger as Peggy from Health Club *Regis Philbin as Regis Philbin *Joy Philbin as Joy Philbin *Niki Patterson as Computer Operator ==Soundtrack== The film's music was composed by [[Henry Strzelecki]], with [[Ronny Light]] producing the soundtrack which featured Strzelecki on bass, [[Bucky Barrett]] and [[Tommy Jones (musician)|Tommy Jones]] on guitar, [[Bobby Thompson (musician)|Bobby Thompson]] playing guitar and banjo, [[Weldon Myrick]] playing guitar and [[Dobro]], [[Barry Walsh]] on piano, [[Dale Morris (musician)|Dale Morris]] on fiddle, [[Terry McMillan (musician)|Terry McMillan]] on harmonica and percussion, and [[Kenny Buttrey]] on drums.https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0089539/fullcredits/?ref_=tt_ov_st_sm ==Reception== ''Malibu Express'' is described as a "routine erotic spy tale" by Eleanor Mannikka of ''All Movie Guide''.{{cite web |url=http://www.allmovie.com/work/malibu-express-31022 |title=Malibu Express|publisher=[[All Movie Guide]] |work=allmovie.com |date= |accessdate=17 July 2010 }} The ''Video Movie Guide 2001'' rated the movie with a single "turkey", amazed that the movie got an "R" rating, "since it's clearly soft porn."{{cite book| title=Video Movie Guide 2001 |author1=Martin, Mick |author2=Porter, Marsha |page=677 |year=2000 |publisher=[[Ballantine Books]] |isbn=978-0-345-42095-4 |url=https://books.google.com/books?ei=gtVDTK2TE5TWtQPMnfnEDA&ct=result&id=2cicEzGKA2kC&dq=Video+Movie+Guide++%22Malibu+Express%22&q=%22Malibu+Express%22#search_anchor |accessdate=17 July 2010}} ''TV Guide'' gave the film two stars.{{cite book |title=TV Guide v. 40, pg. 522 |year=1992 | publisher=Triangle Publications (1992) | url=https://books.google.com/books?ei=1NdDTPeBD46csQOmyv2GDA&ct=result&id=nknvAAAAMAAJ&dq=%22malibu+express%22+%22waste%22&q=%22malibu+express+%281985%29%22#search_anchor |accessdate=17 July 2010}} Barbara Edwards' appearance in the hero's shower is cited as "one of the hottest topless lesbian shower scenes in the long and hot tradition of lesbian shower scenes."{{cite book |title=Mr. Skin's Skincyclopedia: The A-to-Z Guide to Finding Your Favorite Actresses Naked |author=Mr. Skin |authorlink=Mr. Skin |year=2004 |page= 163 | publisher=[[St. Martin's Griffin]] |isbn=978-0-312-33144-3 |accessdate=17 July 2010 | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dMMP94fw3mgC&pg=RA2-PA163#v=onepage&q&f=false}} ==Filming locations== * [[Beverly Hills]] * [[Sunset Boulevard]] in Los Angeles * [[Willow Springs Raceway]] (north of Los Angeles) * [[Mojave Desert]]{{cite news |title=Former resident immortalizes Cerulean Springs in new film|author=Dollar, Rob |newspaper=[[Kentucky New Era]]|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=jPAwAAAAIBAJ&sjid=FOAFAAAAIBAJ&pg=5687%2C620267| page=1A |date=July 7, 1984}} Article written during production, quoting co-producer Bill Pryor. ==Releases== The film was first released in March 1985, then on DVD in 2002. It then appeared in two DVD collections, ''Andy Sidaris Collection, Vol. 1'' (of six discs) in 2003, and ''Triple B Collection, Vol. 1'' in 2005.{{cite web | title=Malibu Express DVD releases |publisher=All Movie Guide| work=allmovie.com |url=http://www.allmovie.com/dvd/releases/malibu-express-31022 |accessdate=17 July 2010}} ==Connections to other films== The material from the film was reworked from a previous Sidaris film, ''[[Stacey (film)|Stacey]]'' (1973). The role of Stacey Hanson ([[Anne Randall]]) was divided into two new characters: private detective protagonist Cody Abilene ([[Darby Hinton]]) and his girlfriend June Khnockers ([[List of Playboy Playmates of 1982#July|Lynda Wiesmeier]]).Coffman (2012), p. 23-26 The openings of both films depict their respective female race car drivers in the finish of a practice race. Both films then have them getting out of uniform. Stacey is the protagonist, though, while June serves mostly as the source of a recurring joke in her film: "Knockers with an "h"?". June can still reliably drive a high-performance race car, but Cody performs most of Stacey's functions in the film.Coffman (2012), p. 23-26 The discreet homosexual nephew John (John Alderman) turns into Stuart (Michael A. Anderson), a [[drag queen]], in the second film. In both films, the detective follows the character into a [[gay bar]]. The difference is that in the first film, John wears regular clothes, while in the second, Stuart is in full drag. Cody laughs while dictating notes in a recorder, but still admits that Stuart has great legs. Stuart is more of a cartoonish gay stereotype than John.Coffman (2012), p. 23-26 The youthful niece Pamela ([[Cristina Raines]]) turns into the bit older niece Liza ([[List of Playboy Playmates of 1981#April|Lorraine Michaels]]) in the second film. Liza has her own sex scene with the houseboy Shane (Brett Clark). The difference in age was probably decided to allow this sex scene and more nudity than would be acceptable from a teenager.Coffman (2012), p. 23-26 The second film adds a character with no counterpart in the original: Contessa Luciana ([[Sybil Danning]]). Contessa has a romantic night with Cody, before he moves into his next assignment. The relationship to the family is unspecified, but she turns out to have murdered Shane. She is beyond the reach of the law and suffers no ill consequences for her murder.Coffman (2012), p. 23-26 ==See also== *[[Girls with guns]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|id=0089539|title=Malibu Express}} * [http://www.nanarland.com/Chroniques/Main.php?id_film=malibuexpress Malibu Express on NanarLand] {{Triple B series}} {{Andy Sidaris}} [[Category:1980s action films]] [[Category:1980s independent films]] [[Category:1980s spy films]] [[Category:1985 films]] [[Category:American action films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:American spy films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Films shot in Los Angeles]] [[Category:American independent films]] [[Category:Universal Pictures films]] [[Category:Films directed by Andy Sidaris]] [[Category:Detective films]]
